article_text:
‘No, no, no, no!” Tom Wheeler shouted at the moderator. The Federal Communications Commission chairman was speaking at an Internet industry conference in March, soon after the FCC voted to regulate the Internet. His bureaucrats, he insisted, would never set rates, rule on tariffs or otherwise treat the Internet like an old-fashioned utility.

Make that “Yes, yes, yes, yes!”

The regulations went into effect earlier this month,...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Information Age columnist Gordon Crovitz writes that the FCC levies a $100 million retroactive fine, and the political favor-seeking is under way.
twitter.title: Obamanet Shows Its Fangs

article_summary:
Make that “Yes, yes, yes, yes!”The regulations went into effect earlier this month,...
‘No, no, no, no!” Tom Wheeler shouted at the moderator.
His bureaucrats, he insisted, would never set rates, rule on tariffs or otherwise treat the Internet like an old-fashioned utility.
The Federal Communications Commission chairman was speaking at an Internet industry conference in March, soon after the FCC voted to regulate the Internet.
